title.native: リストランテ・パラディーゾ

description:
When Nicoletta was a little girl, her mother, Olga, abandoned her and ran off to Rome to remarry. Now, 15 years later and a young woman, she travels to Rome with the intention of ruining her mother's life. She tracks Olga down to a restaurant called Casetta dell'Orso, but the second Nicoletta steps through its door, everything changes. It's a peculiar place staffed entirely by mature gentlemen wearing spectacles, and like their clientele, she is helpless against their wise smiles and warm voices. Before Nicoletta realizes it, her plans for vengeance start to fade, and she's swept up in the sweet romance of everyday Italian life.

(Source: Right Stuf)

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Age Gap
tags.description: Prominently features romantic relations between people with a significant age difference.

tags.name: Restaurant
tags.description: Features a business that prepares and serves food and drinks to customers. Also encompasses cafes and bistros.

tags.name: Food
tags.description: Centers around cooking or food appraisal.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

name.native: サント・クラウディオ・パラディーゾ
ルチアーノ・デ・ルーカ

node.description: After having graduated from Tokyo Designer Gakuin, she joined [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/), and started off as an animator. She is noted as the first female mecha director, and one of the few female directors in the '80s alongside [Makoto Moriwaki](https://anilist.co/staff/109581/) and [Hiroko Tokita](https://anilist.co/staff/101903/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/YasufumiSoejima/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/soejima_yasufumi/) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/ys19710313)

A director with past experience in computer graphics. Former CG animator and director at [Gonzo](https://anilist.co/studio/3/GONZO). He is currently affiliated with [David Production](https://anilist.co/studio/287/).
Co-founder and former representative director of [David Production](https://anilist.co/studio/287/).
Formed in 2004. Led by Shigeharu Sasago, the guitarist of Choro Club.  Members: Shigeharu Sasago (笹子重治) Yuki Etoh (江藤有希) Saeko Kurokawa (黒川紗恵子)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/42231474)

The founder and representative director of [Twin Engine](https://anilist.co/studio/6199/). Originally a producer for [Fuji TV](https://anilist.co/studio/169/), where he produced numerous anime for the Noitamina programming block.
Co-founder and former representative director of [David Production](https://anilist.co/studio/287/).

After having graduated from Tokyo Designer Gakuin, she joined [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/), and started off as an animator. She is noted as the first female mecha director, and one of the few female directors in the '80s alongside [Makoto Moriwaki](https://anilist.co/staff/109581/) and [Hiroko Tokita](https://anilist.co/staff/101903/).
